page.title: 07HEATHCOTE HOSPITAL
page.content: The{Heathcote Hospital}was opened as a 'fever' or Isolation Hospital in 1858. It remained as such for nearly ninety years, treating all types of infectious diseases. In 1950 it became a Chest Hospital changing in 1958 to a Hospital for the Elderly. Since 1976 there have been four wards,accomodating 107 patients.In 1982 a Day Unit was opened;this cares for 125 patients in total at about 25 per day .The purpose of this unit is to maintain elderly people in their own homes for as long as possible. The average age of patients is about 85;most are 'residential' in that they will not get well enough to return home.With this in mind the hospital is as informal and 'homely' as possible,allowing pets in the wards and even having donkeys for ferrying patients around-in a cart of course!
